event.name: AEA_CULT_BEACH
event.text: You've arrived at a vacation planet right in the middle of cultist space. You're even more surprised when all of the marketting for the place is directed towards the cultists.

choice.text: Take some time to relax on the beach.

event.text: You land and let your crew relax across the resort. The place is relatively normal aside from the cult members, but even they turn out to be pretty chill, one of them even offers to join your crew.
As you leave the planet you notice the rebel fleet jumped forwards while you were relaxing.
As you leave the planet you notice the rebel fleet jumped forwards while you were relaxing.

choice.text: Grab some free snacks from the lobby.

event.text: You swing by the lobby and grab some supplies before heading back out.

choice.text: Steal something from lost and found.

event.text: You grab an item from lost and found before sprinting out of there before anyone can catch up to you.

event.name: AEA_CULT_FOOD_DRIVE
event.text: You've arrived at the beacon to discover the cult is running a food drive, theres a long line of people waiting to get a free meal.

choice.text: Donate some supplies to the cause.

event.text: They accept your help readily and appear very thankful, one of the attending even offers to join your crew.
You leave feeling much better about yourself.
You leave feeling much better about yourself.
You prepare to jump to the next beacon.

event.name: AEA_CULT_MAGIC_GATE
event.text: A strange event is going on at this beacon, it appears the cultists have setup some kind of prototype jump gate. They claim it will allow you to jump to any beacon in the sector, they ask you to participate in the test.

You head into the jumpgate and find yourself in hyperspace, there appears to be a few wrecks floating around near you which you scrap for parts. It appears the cultists were right, you can jump to any beacon in the sector from here!.
You prepare to jump to the next beacon.

event.name: AEA_CULT_MYSTERIOUS_VOICE
event.text: You arrive at lush, uncharted planet, your crew begins to hear faint whispers on the comms. Initially, you think it's static, but soon it becomes clear that the whispers are guiding you.

choice.text: Follow the voice and investigate further.

event.text: You follow the faint whispers and eventually arrive at a small, hidden moon, covered with glowing flowers. Theres a large structure on the surface, it appears to be a massive garden. As you enter the heart of their garden the voices go stronger, they ask what you seek...
A platform rises out of the ground, and on it a platter of various supplies.
A platform rises out of the ground, and on it a drone.
A platform rises out of the ground, and on it a weapon.
You prepare to jump to the next beacon.
You prepare to jump to the next beacon.

event.name: AEA_CULT_FACTORY
event.text: There's a factory in use at this beacon, it appears to be guarded by a single cultist ship. Your sensors pick up a pirate ship hiding in an asteroid field nearby.

choice.text: Attack the guard and loot the factory.

event.text: You move in and power on your weapons, the pirate vessel sticks back to watch the engagement.

choice.text: Attack the pirate and defend the factory.

event.text: You engage the pirate, unfortunately the Cultist vessel isn't in any hurry to join you.
You prepare to jump to the next beacon.

event.name: AEA_CULT_CULTIST_FIRE
event.text: You arrive at the beacon to discover a cultist ship aflame near the beacon. Theres no distress beacon but they can't be doing too well over there.

choice.text: (Fireproof Crew) Dock with the ship and send your fireproof crew over.
(Repair Drone) Dock with the ship and send a repair drone into the fire.
(Fire Extinguishers) Dock with the ship and use your ship's fire suppression on the ship.
Dock with the ship and send your crew to help.
Take advantage of their situation and attack.

event.text: You activate your weapons and move in to attack, they notice what you're doing and respond with their own weaponry.

choice.text: You can't help, leave them to their fate.

event.text: You prepare to jump to the next beacon.

event.name: AEA_CULT_CULTIST_FIRE_SUCCEED_GOOD
event.text:
"Oh thank the flower you're here, we don't know what we would have done without you!
Take this scrap as a thank you."

event.name: AEA_CULT_CULTIST_FIRE_SUCCEED_BAD
event.text:
"You've ruined the summoning circle, that fire was completely in control!
You've ruined everything, prepare to die!"

Your crew attempt to put out the fire but are cut off and forced back onboard your own ship, you're barely able to disengage before the fire spreads too much.
You watch the orchid ship go up in flames, once the debree has cooled down you search it for any useful scrap.

Your crew arrive on board to discover a massive summoning circle made out of fire, several orchids seem to be channelling it.
You notice one of the orchids has turned their attention towards your crew and you order a retreat, unfortunately one of your crew gets caught and you watch them combust in a flash of fire.
You only just manage to make it back to your ship before the enemy warps away.

removeCrew.text: Fortunately, you happen to have a Clone Bay to revive your crew.

event.name: AEA_CULT_CULTIST_REQUEST
event.text: A cultist approaches you with a humble request. The vampweed cultists are in need of a rare resource, a specific crystal from a nearby asteroid field. They claim the crystal will be used in a sacred ceremony.

choice.text: Agree to help them and search for the crystal.

event.text: You begin scanning the asteroid field, after a while you detect something right on the edge of the field. Upon closer inspection you discover the crystal the cultists are looking for, and whats more it isn't any old crystal, its a diamond the size of a rockman.

choice.text: Grab the crystal before the cultists see it and get out of there.

event.text: Just when you think no one saw, a cultist vessel intercepts you before you can make it out of the field. They clearly saw you take the crystal and are in no mood to negotiate.

choice.text: Hold true to your promise and bring them the crystal.

event.text: You return to the orchids and present the crystal, they're incredibly thankful for your help and even thank you by giving you more scrap than the crystal was worth.
You prepare to jump to the next beacon.

event.name: AEA_CULT_WHALE
event.text: You've arrived at the beacon to discover a massive herd of space whales travelling past the beacon. The large whale at the head of the pack splits off and heads towards you.
You activate your weapons and move in to attack.

Your cultist begins to communicate with the whale. After understanding your peaceful intentions the whale makes a request of you.
It appears the whale's mate became seperated in an asteroid field a while back, it wants you to go look for it.

choice.text: Agree to find the whale's mate.

event.text: The whale tells your cultist where they were seperated from their mate. It also tells you where to escort their mate to once you find them.
The whale seems disapointed but moves off to rejoin the herd.

Your Gi begins to communicate with the whale. After understanding your peaceful intentions the whale makes a request of you.
It appears the whale's mate became seperated in an asteroid field a while back, it wants you to go look for it.

choice.text: Agree to find the whale's mate.

event.text: The whale tells your cultist where they were seperated from their mate. It also tells you where to escort their mate to once you find them.
The whale seems disapointed but moves off to rejoin the herd.
You, as a whale, attempt to seduce the whale. Unfortunately the whale is uninterested in your advances and once it realizes you don't belong to the herd it leaves.

choice.text: Back off and avoid the whales.

event.text: You prepare to jump to the next beacon.

event.name: AEA_CULT_WHALE_FIELD

beaconType.unvisitedTooltip: The location of the asteroid field where the space whale was seperated from their mate.

event.text: You've arrived at the beacon where the whales got seperated. You begin scanning for the lost whale but it doesn't immediately turn up anything.

choice.text: (Upg. Sensors) Run another scan at maximum sensitivity.

event.text: You run an additional more focused scan and find an abandoned refueling platform.

choice.text: (Adv. Sensors) Run another scan at maximum sensitivity.

event.text: You run an additional more focused scan and find an abandoned refueling platform.

choice.text: (Long-Ranged Scanners) Run another scan at maximum sensitivity.

event.text: You run an additional more focused scan and find an abandoned refueling platform.

choice.text: Keep searching for the whale, this might take a while.

event.text: You keep searching for the whale, time passes and the rebel fleet has caught up to you further.
You prepare to jump to the next beacon.

event.name: AEA_CULT_WHALE_FIND
event.text: Eventually you pickup on a large organic object. On closer inspection you find it's the whale, unfortunately it appears to be under attack by a slug vessel.

event.name: AEA_CULT_WHALE_SAVE
event.text: Your crewmember begins communicating with the now safe whale, it agrees to follow you to the meeting point.

event.name: AEA_CULT_WHALE_MEETING

beaconType.unvisitedTooltip: The location of the whale's meeting point.

event.text: As you arrive at the beacon you look out and see your whale companion excitingly run ahead, it appears that the whale can sense the herd ahead, and their mate.

Even you can pickup on the excited atmosphere created by the whale's return. You wait and watch the whales reunite, after a moment the original whale comes back over to you. The whale expresses their gratitude and asks you to follow it.
Eventually you arrive at a nearby moon, it appears the whales discovered a hidden rebel supply cache. The whale, now content in having payed off your debt, returns back to the herd.
You prepare to jump to the next beacon.

event.name: DISTRESS_AEA_CULT_NO_MAGIC
event.text: You've arrived at the beacon to discover a cultist vessel. They hail you. "Hello, I don't suppose you can help us, we were transporting some spells but we were hit by an asteroid and lost them nearby, our sensors aren't strong enough to pick them up."

choice.text: (Upg. Sensors) Run a scan at maximum sensitivity.

event.text: You run an additional more focused scan and find an abandoned refueling platform.

choice.text: (Adv. Sensors) Run a scan at maximum sensitivity.

event.text: You run an additional more focused scan and find an abandoned refueling platform.

choice.text: (Long-Ranged Scanners) Run a scan at maximum sensitivity.

event.text: You run an additional more focused scan and find an abandoned refueling platform.
You turn your weapons on and engage the cultists.
You prepare to jump to the next beacon.

event.name: AEA_CULT_MAGIC_FIND
event.text: Eventually you locate the lost spells, you deliver them back to the cultists and they offer to repay you with scrap and your choice of spells.
They transfer the scrap and spell.
They transfer the scrap and spell.
They transfer the scrap and spell.

textList.name: TEXT_ENCOUNTER_AEA_CULT
textList.text: "The Federation clings to the past, but you shall find it will be your own undoing for pushing us away! When Ivar sees the truth and joins the Coalition, your hypocritical leaders will be annihilated! And until then, we'll have to make do with picking off you intrusive Universe 0 Renegades!"

Following the Federation-Mantis war, it was agreed during the Kadahellian'ek Treaty that the Gathering and Confederacy would never enter war against each other. Despite this, tensions remain high, and it seems many Vampweeds still hold history against the Federation. One particularly radical vessel nearby locks onto you!.

Vampweeds might not be your friends, but it's not too typical for them to act in such aggressive manners. However, scans show the crew of the nearby ship have succumbed to some kind of parasite that creates irrational behavior. Prepare to fight!.

"And so it's true, the Federation has finally sent Renegades to renew the old war! Well, we won't take this insult without a fight, scum!" Unfortunately, the ship refuses to listen to you, meaning a fight is inevitable.

A drunk Vampweed factory worker's vessel lurches towards you. "Ehhh... dumbass... Feds in my sector? You'll regret this, hear me!" Despite barely being able to form a coherent sentence, the captain is able to order his crew to attack!.

Vampweeds are known to drink a fair bit as a culture, and intoxicated Orchids aren't an uncommon sight here. Unfortunately, the side effects of heavy drinking tend to cause irrational decisions, such as engaging Renegades in combat!.
"I didn't side with the Hive during the old war, but now? Now I think I should have! The Federation has done nothing but push us away when we needed it most, and you're going to regret that!"

"Ivar has grown weak in trying to defend you Federation filth! It is time for insurrection, time to plant the seeds of rebellion so that it may flower into a galaxy where your lies no longer corrupt our youth!"

event.name: ENCOUNTER_AEA_CULT_STATION
event.text: "Stop right there! This sector is a designated safe zone, non-Confederate military vessels are forbidden from entering this region!" You don't remember seeing such restrictions posted anywhere, but it seems you don't have time to argue. Get ready to fight!.

event.name: ENCOUNTER_AEA_CULT_ELITE
event.text: "The Confederacy is not the stomping grounds of the Federation or its hitmen! Your presence here violates the basic rights of any person to enjoy peace and prosperity without the invasion of intrusive foreign governments!" A proud Cultivator, claiming to act in the goodwill of his people, raises his weapons and attacks your ship!.

event.name: AEA_CULT_FLOWER_GOD

beaconType.unvisitedTooltip: The location of the giant space flower the cultists worship.

event.text: You've arrived at the location of the one flower, you can see the massive flower in orbit above the planet, aswell as hundreds of ships surrounding it.

You approach the flower and receive a hail directly from the flower. It appears many other ships are also in communication with the flower.
An inorganic voice speaks to you. "Ah, a renegade, I don't see your kind here often. I have a task for you if you're interested, two infact."

"The first task is an easy one, I need you to transport one of my seeds to a nearby sector. The only thing you'll need to be careful of is the seed's fragility, try to keep it safe."
"The second task I have for you is more complicated, I have recently become aware of a plot to try and destroy and replace me with a fake. I need you to investigate the situation and resolve it, how you do is up to you."

The flower transmits the coordinates and wishes you luck with the tasks. You leave the flower and explore the planet. You find a large store on the planet, Multiple Orchids wave to customers, trying to get their attention, while curious shoppers of various species look about.
Continue...

The flower transmits the coordinates and wishes you luck with the task. You leave the flower and explore the planet. You find a large store on the planet, Multiple Orchids wave to customers, trying to get their attention, while curious shoppers of various species look about.

The flower transmits the coordinates and wishes you luck with the task. You leave the flower and explore the planet. You find a large store on the planet, Multiple Orchids wave to customers, trying to get their attention, while curious shoppers of various species look about.

You leave the flower and explore the planet. You find a large store on the planet, Multiple Orchids wave to customers, trying to get their attention, while curious shoppers of various species look about.

choice.text: Ignore the flower and explore the planet.

event.text: You find a large store on the planet, Multiple Orchids wave to customers, trying to get their attention, while curious shoppers of various species look about.

choice.text: Leave as soon as your drive is charged.

event.text: You prepare to jump to the next beacon.

event.name: AEA_CULT_POLLEN

beaconType.unvisitedTooltip: The planet the flower sent you to seed.

event.text: You've arrived at the location the flower asked you to deliver the seed to.

You take the seed down to the planet and find a large garden on the surface. At the center of the garden you find a strange structure, it appears to have a pedestal like growth where you could put the seed.

You insert the seed into the structure and it shifts and retracts into the ground. A moment later a tiny orchid sprouts from the ground. It doesn't seem to be able to talk, but it does gesture for you to follow it.
Eventually it leads you to a supply stash, it helps you load it up into the ship and then gets onboard with you, it seems like this tiny orchid is a new crewMember.

choice.text: Forget about the flowers instructions and leave.

event.text: You prepare to jump to the next beacon.

event.name: AEA_CULT_CONSPIRACY

beaconType.unvisitedTooltip: The location of the conspiracy's hideout.

event.text: You've arrived at the location of the conspiracy's hideout, they've taken over an abandoned factory, however in order to keep their secrecy there are no guards or other systems that give away their location, you're able to land nearby and sneak into the compound.

event.name: AEA_CULT_CONSPIRACY_COMPOUND
event.text: You're able to makeout a few different locations around the compound. There's a workshop with visable ship components inside. A storage yard with a few shipping containers spread about. A generator building that appears to be powerering the rest of the facility. An old hangar off to one side, you can't see inside of it. Finally theres the main command facility, your sensors indicate this is where the conspirators are, it appears they're all currently asleep.

event.name: AEA_CULT_CON_WORKSHOP
event.text: You arrive in the workshop, it appears the workers have gone to sleep for the night.
Your search reveals nothing useful, infact the only bits you can make use out of arc a few drone parts.

choice.text: You have already searched the workshop.

event.name: AEA_CULT_CON_STORAGE
event.text: You arrive in the storage yard, it's deserted and empty aside from a few shipping containers..
You begin openning up the shipping containers, most are empty. It's only on the second to last crate that you discover a ship augment. You don't find anything else.

choice.text: You have already searched the storage yard.

event.name: AEA_CULT_CON_GENERATOR
event.text: You arrive in the generator room, Access to the actual generator is blocked by a heavy security checkpoint. It's unlikely you'll be able to get inside the generator itself.

event.name: AEA_CULT_CON_GENERATOR_CODE
event.text:
The room you're in is rather bare, on one side theres a thick glass window into the security control room, on another wall is an emergency escape route map, probably leftover from when this place wasn't abandoned.
You're unable to find anything in the room, however you notice a sticky note through the glass window with a code on it: .

event.name: AEA_CULT_CON_hangar
event.text: You arrive at the hangar, you search the perimeter but can't find any way in, all of the doors are locked shut or sealed up.

choice.text: You cannot search the hangar as you cannot find a way inside.

event.name: AEA_CULT_CON_COMPOUND
event.text: You search for a way into the compound, but it appears they did a very thorough job of securing it and the only way in is via the front door, additionally it's locked behind a keypad, you'll need to find the code in order to unlock the door.

event.name: AEA_CULT_CON_ENTER_CODE
event.text: Entering Code: XXXX.
You submit the code, however it appears you got it wrong and the door sends out an electric pulse which damages your ship.

event.name: AEA_CULT_CON_INSIDE
event.text: You're able to make it inside and sneak through the compound, eventually you come upon the security controls for the compound.

choice.text: Lock the conspirators in their rooms.

event.text:
You manage to secure the conspirators and you alert the cultist police forces.
As you're watching you notice that one of the conspirator's room didn't lock properly, and what's more you're unable to find them, rewinding the footage you see them escape towards the hangar.

As you make it back out of the base you see a strange vessel take to the air, it looks like the Oneflower, but something's off. You don't have time to work it out as it begins an attack run on you. You only just make it back to your ship in time.

event.name: AEA_CULT_CON_FLOWER_DEAD
event.text:
The ship explodes, as it fragments it reveals the interior of the ship. It turns out the flower was actually an advanced autoship the conspirators had built.
You're able to scrap the fragments of the ship and discover a weapon amongst the wreckage.

With the autoship dealt with you're able to round up the last conspirator just in time for the cultist police force to arrive and secture the conspirators.
You recieve a message from the Oneflower, it thanks you for a job well done and you recieve a payment of scrap.

event.name: TRAPPER_AEA_CULT
event.text: "Renegade, this is a restricted zone. Did you not notice the minefield at this beacon? You can't be here!" A Cultist minelayer watches your movements, clearly hoping you'll leave without causing more of a scene.

choice.text: Attack, we can steal their Mine Launcher tech!.

event.text: You've taken the risky choice of fighting the ship. Hopefully, you can protect yourself from their salvo long enough.
Messing with a Trapper is a bad idea.
